verses.roman:
yadyapi sāṅkhya māne, 'pradhāna'--kāraṇa
jaḍa ha-ite kabhu nahe jagat-sṛjana

synonyms: yadyapi—although; sāṅkhya—Sāṅkhya philosophy; māne—accepts; pradhāna—ingredients; kāraṇa—cause; jaḍa ha-ite—from matter; kabhu—at any time; nahe—there is not; jagat-sṛjana—the creation of the material world.
translation: Although the Sāṅkhya philosophy accepts that the material ingredients are the cause, the creation of the world never arises from dead matter.
